title: Editorial: American Education Needs Radical Reform, Not Band-Aids
introText: American students continue falling behind international peers despite decades of incremental reforms. The system itself needs fundamental restructuringâ€”from how we train teachers to what we teach and how we measure success.

content.content: American students rank in the middle of developed nations despite spending more per pupil than almost any country. Reading and math scores have stagnated for decades. The achievement gap persists.
Standardized testing has narrowed curriculum without improving outcomes. Teacher training is disconnected from classroom realities. Funding inequities perpetuate advantage for the already privileged.

Raise teacher pay and prestige. Equalize funding across districts. Integrate technology thoughtfully. Focus on critical thinking, not test preparation. These changes require political courage we've lacked.
